SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE RELEASE NOTES AND UPGRADE GUIDE
Upgrade to B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (Version 4.11)

B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11) introduces changes that affect the Product List page, Checkout page, and your storefront's Experience Cloud site. These changes can disrupt your existing storefront after you upgrade the managed package. To resolve these changes in your B2B Commerce solution and keep your storefront working correctly, complete the following upgrade steps.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS
Salesforce CompatibilitySalesforce not available in all orgs) and Lightning Experience for Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.


B2B Commerce Compatibility

Any solution upgrading to B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11) or later



USER PERMISSIONS NEEDED
To access CC Admin and change settings:	Access B2B Commerce for Visualforce Admin Settings permission set
To create, customize, or publish an Experience Cloud site:	

Create and Set Up Experiences

AND

View Setup and Configuration

IMPORTANT These steps are required for every B2B Commerce for Visualforce solution upgrading to Summer ’19 (version 4.11). However, these steps don't cover every new feature or change in this version. Depending on which features you want to use or which changes affect your existing solution, other upgrade steps are necessary. Check out the individual Summer ’19 (version 4.11) release notes for upgrade steps related to specific changes.
TIP Before you begin, complete the steps in Prepare Your Existing B2B Commerce for Visualforce Data for Upgrade and ensure that you've resolved the prerequisites for upgrading the managed package.
To install B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11), complete the steps in Upgrade the B2B Commerce for Visualforce Managed Package. Select the appropriate installation URL for your version and org type.
If your upgrade path includes other major versions, resolve disruptive changes introduced in those versions.
Upgrade to B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’18 (Version 4.9)
Upgrade to B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ‘19 (Version 4.10)
If you're using the Product List page version 2.0, go to CC Admin | Global Settings | Indexing and build a new product index.
IMPORTANT This CC Product Index object includes new fields. This change breaks your existing Product List page until the first time that you rebuild the product index after upgrading the managed package. Depending on the complexity of product data on your storefront, the product index build job can take several hours or longer to complete.
Review the details about version 2.0 of the Order Review section of the Checkout page, and determine whether you want to start using this version.
NOTE Version 2.0 of the Order Review section of the Checkout page is enabled by default after you completed the following steps in Upgrade the B2B Commerce for Visualforce Managed Package:
Upgrade the available global data.
Build and activate a new configuration cache.
If you decide to continue using the legacy version 1.0 of the Order Review section of the Checkout page, complete the following steps. If you want to start using version 2.0, skip this step.
On the CC Admin tab in your org, select your storefront (1).
In the Storefront Settings menu, select Configuration Settings (2).
From the Module picklist, select Order Review (3).
Find the Use Order Review Page 2.0 setting and click Override in the Action column.
In the New Page Setting window, enter FALSE for Value, and click Create.
Build and activate a new configuration cache.
If you rely on canonical URLs for your storefront's search engine optimization (SEO) strategy, enable a new configuration setting. This step is important to ensure that B2B Commerce for Visualforce continues to insert canonical URLs.
NOTE If your storefront supports multiple languages, enabling this configuration setting also adds alternate language links to your page metadata.
Return to your storefront configuration settings. From the Module picklist, select User Interface.
Find the Enable Canonical and Alternate Language Links setting, and click Override in the Action column.
In the New Page Setting window, enter TRUE for Value, and click Create.
Build and activate a new configuration cache
If you support customer service representative (CSR) flow, update the permission set assigned to your CSR users.
To start using B2B Commerce Lightning components in an existing Salesforce Tabs + Visualforce Experience Builder template, modify your site to use a Lightning template. If you don't plan on using these components, you can skip this step.
From Setup, enter Sites in the Quick Find box, and then select All Sites under Digital Experiences.
Click Workspaces next to your site, and then click the Administration workspace tile.
On the Settings page, click Change Template.
Select a Lightning-enabled template:
NOTE The components are supported on every Experience Builder template. However, your organization’s contract agreements can restrict which templates you're allowed to use. The Build Your Own template has no contract restrictions, and the components are compatible with any theme you select for the Build Your Own template.
Click Get Started.
On the Enter a Name page, enter the same site name and URL that you used when you first created the site.
In the Administration workspace, leave all of your site settings unchanged.
TIP To get started with the B2B Commerce Lightning components in Experience Builder, return to All Sites under Setup. Click Builder next to your site.
If you haven't already, verify that you've updated your org's sharing and security settings. Complete the steps in the following topics:
Update External Access Sharing Settings for B2B Commerce for Visualforce Custom Objects
Resolve Guest User Security Alerts to Keep Your Storefronts Secure by Default
TIP If you've already resolved these security alerts for a previous version of B2B Commerce for Visualforce, you can relax! No extra action is necessary after you upgrade the managed package.
Review the list of other fixes in this release, and complete any required upgrade steps.
Finally, determine your next steps:
If your upgrade path isn't complete and still includes B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12), continue to Upgrade to B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (Version 4.12).
If you're not upgrading any further than B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11), review the information in Patch Notes for B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (Version 4.11). For each patch that precedes the build you installed, complete any required upgrade steps.
TIP Yes, some patches contain fixes that require you to complete extra steps. Each patch release is also cumulative, and contains all the fixes from the same major version's previous patches. For example, let's say that you when you upgraded to Summer ’19 (version 4.11) from Spring ’19 (version 4.10), you installed build 3.145.9. Review the notes from all B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11) patches that preceded 3.145.9, and complete any extra upgrade steps.
